bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 18 (Friday, January 28, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LYNCH:H.R. 6524.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 3[Page H309]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text: This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to report on the financial activities of China and Chinese entities in connection with the finances of Afghanistan and the Taliban, including activities to support illicit financial networks.

bill.title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to carry out a study on Chinese support for Afghan illicit finance, and for other purposes.

item.title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to carry out a study on Chinese support for Afghan illicit finance, and for other purposes.
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to carry out a study on Chinese support for Afghan illicit finance, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
